meanings.definition: To become mature or fully developed.
meanings.sent1: The fruit will maturate on the tree before it is ready to eat.
meanings.sent2: Plants need time to maturate and grow strong roots.
meanings.sent3: I hope my baking skills maturate as well as this delicious cake!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas began to maturate like a fine wine, gaining depth and complexity.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between the two children continued to maturate, becoming stronger with each passing day.

meanings.definition: To cause to mature or ripen.
meanings.sent1: The warm sun will help maturate the tomatoes on the vine.
meanings.sent2: Proper care and attention can maturate a young plant into a thriving one.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient seemed to maturate the flavors in the dish, making it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: His guidance acted as a catalyst to maturate her skills, bringing out her full potential.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's advice helped maturate his understanding of the subject, leading to academic success.
